author: SidShetye
body:
Get-ChildItem and other filesystem commands should allow case insensitivity to allow for cross platform powershell scripting. Without this the scripts are unable to shield user from filesystem differences across Windows, macOS and Linux. Perhaps an additional parameter like `-IgnoreCase` would help?

Steps to reproduce
------------------

```powershell
PS /temp/App.Test> touch App.config
PS /temp/App.Test> gci . -Recurse -Filter "app.config" 
PS /temp/App.Test>
```

Expected behavior
-----------------

```powershell
PS /temp/App.Test> gci . -Recurse -Filter "app.config" -IgnoreCase                                                                               


    Directory: /temp/App.Test


Mode                LastWriteTime         Length Name                                                                                                                                               
----                -------------         ------ ----                                                                                                                                               
------          6/28/18   8:12 PM            687 App.config   
```

Actual behavior
---------------

```powershell
PS /temp/App.Test> gci . -Recurse -Filter "app.config"  
PS /temp/App.Test> gci . -Recurse -Filter "App.config"                                                                                


    Directory: /temp/App.Test


Mode                LastWriteTime         Length Name                                                                                                                                               
----                -------------         ------ ----                                                                                                                                               
------          6/28/18   8:12 PM            687 App.config   
```
